title: [DREAMER] Implement comprehensive integration tests for skipped tests
overview:
Several integration and unit tests are skipped, including System2 coordinator tests, starvation tests, and multi-provider tests. This reduces confidence in the system and allows regressions in untested code paths.

**Motivation:** High test coverage is critical for a distributed cybernetic system. Skipped tests represent gaps in validation and potential sources of bugs. Enabling these tests improves system reliability.

**Success criteria:**
- All System2 tests run without skipping
- Integration tests for multi-provider LLM routing
- Starvation tests validate resource management
- CI/CD runs full test suite
- Test coverage above 80%

**Technical constraints:**
- Some tests require external services (LLM providers)
- Need proper test fixtures and mocks
- Tests should be fast enough for CI/CD
- Must handle flaky integration tests

**In scope:**
- Unskip and fix System2 coordinator tests
- Implement multi-provider integration tests
- Fix starvation test assertions
- Add test data fixtures
- Document test requirements
**Out of scope:**
- Implementing the features being tested (separate)
- Unit tests (those exist)
- Performance tests (separate suite)

**Signals:** priority: medium, urgency: Quality assurance gap
